src.inference.runners package¶

Submodules¶

src.inference.runners.carpark_inference_runner module¶

Legacy Rush Hour (car-park) inference entrypoint.

This module forwards directly to src.inference.domains.carpark.carpark_core and is kept only for CLI compatibility. For new runs, prefer the unified CLI src.inference.cli.unified_carpark.

src.inference.runners.openr1_math_runner module¶

Legacy OpenR1-style batch inference for Qwen-2.5-7B checkpoints.

Emits <think> … </think><answer> … </answer> blocks that are easy to grade on OpenR1-Math-style data. This script is kept for backwards compatibility and specialized experiments; for canonical MATH-500 / HF evaluation, prefer src.inference.runners.unified_math_runner.

class src.inference.runners.openr1_math_runner.BatchWriteContext(config: InferenceConfig, output_path: str, seen_problems: set)[source]¶

Bases: object

Context object passed to _write_batch_rows().

Parameters:

  • config – Inference configuration used for the run.

  • output_path – Path to the JSONL file being written.

  • seen_problems – Set of problems that have already been written.

config: InferenceConfig¶
output_path: str¶
seen_problems: set¶
class src.inference.runners.openr1_math_runner.InferenceConfig(split_name: str, step: int, output_dir: str, batch_size: int, num_samples: int, temperature: float, examples: object)[source]¶

Bases: object

Configuration bundle for a single inference run.

Parameters:

  • split_name – Name of the dataset split being processed.

  • step – Training or checkpoint step identifier for logging and filenames.

  • output_dir – Directory where JSONL results will be written.

  • batch_size – Number of examples to process per batch.

  • num_samples – Number of samples to generate per problem.

  • temperature – Sampling temperature for generation.

  • examples – Dataset object providing select and iteration.

src.inference.runners.openr1_math_runner.append_jsonl(path: str, row: dict) → None[source]¶

Append a JSON-serializable row to a JSONL file, creating parent directories.

Parameters:

  • path – Path to the JSONL file to append to.

  • row – Mapping or object that can be serialized by json.

Returns:

None. The row is appended to path on disk.

src.inference.runners.openr1_math_runner.run_inference_on_split(config: InferenceConfig) → None[source]¶

Convenience wrapper for backward compatibility.

This entry point exists for older call sites and simply indicates that the caller must provide a tokenizer and model via run_inference_on_split_with_model().

Parameters:

config – Inference configuration for the run.

Returns:

None. The function always raises a RuntimeError.

Raises:

RuntimeError – Always; callers should use run_inference_on_split_with_model.

src.inference.runners.openr1_math_runner.run_inference_on_split_with_model(config: InferenceConfig, *, tokenizer, lm_model) → None[source]¶

Generate completions, compute average token entropy, and save JSONL rows.

Parameters:

  • config – Inference configuration specifying dataset and generation parameters.

  • tokenizer – Tokenizer used to encode prompts and decode outputs.

  • lm_model – Hugging Face-style model exposing a generate method.

Returns:

None. Results are appended to the output JSONL file.

src.inference.runners.summarize_inference_runner module¶

Aggregate crossword pass-1/pass-2 evaluation JSONLs by step.

This CLI focuses on parsing arguments, wiring filters, and delegating to the

core aggregation helpers defined in summarize_inference_core.

Assumes crossword inference JSONLs where:

  • rec[“problem”] holds the clue text

  • rec[“gold_answer_canon”] is the canonical gold

  • rec[“pass1”][“pred_answer_canon”], rec[“pass2”][“pred_answer_canon”] exist

  • rec[“pass1”][“soft_reward”] (optional) holds a soft similarity score in [0,1]

  • rec[“pass2”][“soft_reward”] (optional) holds a soft similarity score in [0,1]

src.inference.runners.summarize_inference_runner.main() → None[source]¶

CLI entrypoint that filters and aggregates crossword inference JSONL results.

Returns:

None. The function parses arguments, performs aggregation, and prints summaries.

src.inference.runners.unified_carpark_runner module¶

Library helpers for the Rush Hour (car-park) unified runner.

The CLI wiring now lives in src.inference.cli.unified_carpark.

src.inference.runners.unified_carpark_runner.load_carpark_module()[source]¶

Resolve the Rush Hour inference module.

Returns:

Imported src.inference.domains.carpark.carpark_core module.

src.inference.runners.unified_crossword_runner module¶

Library helpers for the unified crossword runner.

CLI wiring now lives in src.inference.cli.unified_crossword.

src.inference.runners.unified_crossword_runner.load_crossword_module()[source]¶

Resolve the crossword inference module.

Returns:

Imported src.inference.domains.crossword.crossword_core module.

src.inference.runners.unified_math_runner module¶

Library helpers for the unified math runner.

CLI wiring lives in src.inference.cli.unified_math.

src.inference.runners.unified_math_runner.run_math_inference(*, backend, config: MathTestConfig | None = None, **config_overrides) → None[source]¶

Test helper for running math inference with a simple backend + dataset.

Builds a MathTestConfig and delegates to the shared run_math_inference() implementation in unified_runner_base.

src.inference.runners.unified_runner_base module¶

Shared helpers for unified inference runners (math / carpark / crossword).

This module centralizes argument parsing and backend/dataset wiring so that the thin CLI entrypoint modules (cli.unified_math, cli.unified_carpark, cli.unified_crossword) can stay tiny. This keeps Pylint’s duplicate-code (R0801) noise low while preserving testability.

class src.inference.runners.unified_runner_base.MathTestConfig(*args, **kwargs)[source]¶

Bases: object

Lightweight configuration container for test-only math inference.

Mirrors the key fields of MathInferenceConfig without requiring datasets, while grouping related settings into nested containers to keep instance attributes small for linting and readability.

Parameters:

  • dataset – Iterable of dicts representing math examples.

  • output_dir – Directory where JSONL results will be written.

  • step – Training or checkpoint step identifier.

  • eos_ids – EOS token ID or IDs used to terminate generation.

  • batch_size – Number of examples to process per batch (kwarg).

  • num_samples – Number of samples to generate per problem (kwarg).

  • temperature – Sampling temperature for generation (kwarg).

  • top_p – Nucleus-sampling parameter for generation (kwarg).

  • think_cap – Token cap for <think> generations (kwarg).

  • answer_cap – Token cap for <answer> generations (kwarg).

  • two_pass – Whether to enable the reconsideration second pass (kwarg).

  • second_pass_phrase – Cue phrase injected into second-pass prompts (kwarg).

  • second_pass_use_sample_idx – Preferred sample index to feed pass 2 (kwarg).

dataset: Iterable[dict]¶
eos_ids: List[int] | None = None¶
limits: GenerationLimits¶
output_dir: str¶
sampling: _MathInferenceSampling¶
step: int¶

src.inference.runners.unified_runner_base.run_carpark_main(load_module, backend_cls, argv: Sequence[str] | None = None) → None[source]¶

Entry point logic for unified carpark (Rush Hour) inference.

Parameters:

  • load_module – Callable returning the carpark module to use.

  • backend_cls – Backend class (typically HFBackend) to construct.

  • argv – Optional sequence of argument strings; defaults to sys.argv.

Returns:

None. The function parses arguments and runs inference.

src.inference.runners.unified_runner_base.run_crossword_main(load_module, backend_cls, argv: Sequence[str] | None = None) → None[source]¶

Run cryptic crossword inference with a unified HF backend.

Parameters:

  • load_module – Callable returning the crossword module to use.

  • backend_cls – Backend class (typically HFBackend) to construct.

  • argv – Optional sequence of argument strings; defaults to sys.argv.

Returns:

None. The function parses arguments and runs inference.

src.inference.runners.unified_runner_base.run_math_inference(*, backend, config: MathTestConfig) → None[source]¶

Lightweight math inference helper used by tests.

This wraps math_core.run_inference_on_split() with a minimal Dataset-like adapter so tests don’t depend on datasets.Dataset.

Parameters:

  • backend – Backend instance exposing tokenizer and model attributes.

  • config – Test configuration describing dataset and sampling parameters.

Returns:

None. Results are written to config.output_dir.

src.inference.runners.unified_runner_base.run_math_main(backend_cls, argv: Sequence[str] | None = None) → None[source]¶

Entry point logic for unified math inference using math_core.

Parameters:

  • backend_cls – Backend class (typically HFBackend) to construct.

  • argv – Optional sequence of argument strings; defaults to sys.argv.

Returns:

None. The function parses arguments and runs inference.

Module contents¶

CLI entrypoints and shared runner wiring for inference.

Modules in this subpackage are intended to be executed as scripts (python -m src.inference.runners.<name>) and to remain thin wrappers around the core and utils layers.
